comments: Dr Brown is a super awesome prof, probably one of the best soil science profs in the faculty of LFS, but don\'t take this the wrong way, I absolutely hated the course because of the physics and chemistry part of soil science. The only reason why I go to class is because Dr Brown teaches it. Would strongly recommend Dr Brown.

tag_professor: Caring (4)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (3)  ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS (3)  Respected (3)  Hilarious (2)  Gives good feedback (1)  Amazing lectures (1)  Participation matters (1)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)  Inspirational (1)  Clear grading criteria (1)
stu_tags: HILARIOUS  PARTICIPATION MATTERS  ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS
comments: Sandra is very passionate about the subject matter as well as getting to know her students. A lot of testable content is NOT on the slides so come to class and pay attention! I personally learn best from written information not verbal so the teaching style was not for me, however Sandra is still great and is always available to help. average was 80

tag_professor: Caring (4)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (3)  ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS (3)  Respected (3)  Hilarious (2)  Gives good feedback (1)  Amazing lectures (1)  Participation matters (1)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)  Inspirational (1)  Clear grading criteria (1)
stu_tags: SKIP CLASS? YOU WON\'T PASS.  RESPECTED  CLEAR GRADING CRITERIA
comments: Sandy\'s great, made me appreciate what I never thought I would: soil. It\'s surprisingly difficult subject matter, but Sandra knows her stuff and will try her best to make sure you know it too. She\'s super entertaining, especially when she\'s failing to remember someone\'s name. Do the homework, go to the labs, you\'ll be all right.

tag_professor: Caring (4)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (3)  ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS (3)  Respected (3)  Hilarious (2)  Gives good feedback (1)  Amazing lectures (1)  Participation matters (1)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)  Inspirational (1)  Clear grading criteria (1)
stu_tags: CARING  GIVES GOOD FEEDBACK  AMAZING LECTURES
comments: Amazing professor; very knowledgeable, patient, approachable, funny. You will have to work hard, but it is on par with a science course. Can skip a little do not recommend it. There are many resources/TAs available, course is extremely well organized and book is useful. Level of education I expect from UBC but do not always get. Thank you Sandra!

tag_professor: Caring (4)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (3)  ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS (3)  Respected (3)  Hilarious (2)  Gives good feedback (1)  Amazing lectures (1)  Participation matters (1)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)  Inspirational (1)  Clear grading criteria (1)
comments: Soil sciences doesn\'t interest me to begin with but the class was okay. The labs are easy and so are the exams if you understand the concepts and done the practice exams. The lecture slides give minimal information so definitely jot down the notes she writes in class - which can be all over the place but they do help a lot.

comments: As previously stated, the class has a lot of guest lecture material and Sandra is more of the fill in the blanks and compile everything prof. Sometimes doesnt have all the answers but always has a referral. Very humble, and just a great prof. Made me want to go to class.

tag_professor: Caring (4)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (3)  ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS (3)  Respected (3)  Hilarious (2)  Gives good feedback (1)  Amazing lectures (1)  Participation matters (1)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)  Inspirational (1)  Clear grading criteria (1)
comments: Awesome prof. Cares about her students and is extremely helpful. First week of class tells her students to call her Sandra. This class is actually taught by many other guest profs, but she helps out with questions about their assignments. Take SOIL 200 before this course. It will help you alot.
